job.title: Machine Learning Engineer
job.description: <p>Title: <u>Engineering Internship (Machine Learning Engineer)</u></p><p>Job Description </p><p>Noria Water Technologies seeks an intern with experience working in a laboratory environment and basic knowledge of image analysis and machine learning interested in gaining real-world experience. We are a water technology company providing unique solutions for improving operations of water-based processes through real-time monitoring, big data, and analytic capabilities. The candidate must be able to thrive in a dynamic, multi-disciplinary, and hands-on environment that values excellence, creativity, and innovation.</p><p>Terms</p><p> <u>Fall 2021 from August to December</u></p><p> Part-time during the school year: must be able to work 15-20 hours/week</p><p> Flexible schedule can be arranged for part-time work during normal business hours</p><p>Responsibilities</p><p> In-person laboratory work</p><p> Support of development projects</p><p> Characterization of images of fouled/ scaled materials</p><p> Set up and run reverse-osmosis experiments</p><p> Setup image collection system, collect data, and apply image processing and machine learning techniques</p><p> Assists with designs, experiments and assemblies as requested</p><p>Benefits</p><p> Practical experience with a wide variety of water treatment and desalination and data science tasks</p><p> Collaborating hand-in-hand with interdisciplinary team</p><p> Shadowing, mentoring, and training opportunities with seasoned professionals</p><p> Flexible schedule for students</p><p> Noria facilities are spacious with strict adherence to COVID-19 protection requirements</p><p>Qualifications </p><p>Required to be currently enrolled in a full-time Bachelor's degree or Graduate degree STEM program at an accredited college or university</p><p> Must work on-site and be fully vaccinated</p><p> Laboratory experience required</p><p> Knowledge of basic data science and ability to use machine learning tools for image analysis</p><p> Excellent analytical and mathematics skills</p><p> Good verbal and written communications skills with ability to work in a team environment</p><p> Experience programming in Python / C / C++, with AWS, or drawing CAD is a plus </p><p>Job Function </p><p>Engineering, Physical Sciences, Research, Science and Mathematics </p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Location </p><p>Los Angeles, California United States</p><p><u>&nbsp;</u></p><p>Salary Level </p><p>Paid </p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Approximate Hours Per Week </p><p>20 </p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Startup </p><p>Yes </p><p><u>&nbsp;</u></p><p>Desired Start Date </p><p>August 9, 2021 </p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Duration </p><p>August - December 2021</p>
